sn21.12:4.2: Then two mendicants who were companions, pupils of Venerable Mahākappina, went to see the Buddha.
sn21.12:4.3: The Buddha saw them coming off in the distance,
sn21.12:4.5: “Mendicants, do you you see those monks coming who are companions, pupils of Venerable Mahākappina?”
sn21.12:4.7: “Those mendicants are very mighty and powerful. It’s not easy to find an attainment that they have not already attained.
sn21.12:4.9: And they’ve realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. They live having achieved with his own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.”
sn21.12:5.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn21.12:5.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn21.12:6.2: have been together for a long time.
sn21.12:6.3: The true teaching has brought them together,
sn21.12:6.4: the teaching announced by the Buddha.
sn21.12:7.1: They’ve been well trained by Kappina
sn21.12:7.2: in the teaching announced by the noble one.
sn21.12:7.4: having defeated Māra and his mount.”
sn21.12:11.1: The Linked Discourses on monks are complete.
sn21.12:15.1: The Book of Causality is finished.
